intro: Chloraea homopetala, commonly known as the white-flowered chloraea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially grown.
